intro: Stephanomeria pentachaeta, commonly known as the five-toothed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped with five distinct teeth, giving it its common name. Stephanomeria pentachaeta is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
